dct_title_s: 1859 Lamborn Map of the City of Trenton and Part of Hamilton Township, Mercer County, New Jersey
dct_description_sm: An 1859 color map of Trenton and part of Hamilton Township. The map is bordered with 20 beautiful engravings of the city's prominent churches, factories, commercial businesses and homes of several of Trenton's distinguished residents of the time. See "Note" for list of engravings. Map scale: 1 inch = 400 ft.
List of engravings bordering map from top left corner and proceeding clockwise:
E.W. Page & Co., Planing Mill, Sash, Blind and Door Factory
Grant and Bodine���s Coal and Lumber Yard
Residence of James Hoy, Greenwood Avenue
Residence of J.C. Potts, Esq., Greenwood Avenue
Residence of Isaac Stephens, Greenwood Avenue
New Jersey State Normal School
Ashley Cottage
Speeler, Taylor & Bloor���s Porcelain Manufactory
J.G. Bearley & Co./ Gould & Son
Family Mansion of W.E. Hunt U.S.N.
Cottage of C. C. Haven
Third Presbyterian Church, Parsonage and Residence of Elias Cook, Esq.
Trenton Locomotive and Machine Works
St. Michaels Episcopal Church
Front Street M.E. Church
The Mercer Cemetery
Residence of J. S. Fish, Esq. 73 East State Street
Residences of C. Moore and I. Moore, State Street
John C. Grant Marble and Brown Stone Yard, Quarry Street
Catholic Church of St. John the Baptist
James S. Sterling���s
